AgencyLongName: Publications Office of the European Union

crime-org.Name: Participation in a criminal organisation
crime-org.Description: Participation in a criminal organisation, as defined in Article 2 of Council Framework Decision 2008/841/JHA
crime-org.eng: Participation in a criminal organisation, as defined in Article 2 of Council Framework Decision 2008/841/JHA

corruption.Name: Corruption
corruption.Description: Corruption, as defined in Article 3 of the Convention on the fight against corruption involving officials of the European Communities or officials of Member States of the European Union  and Article 2(1) of Council Framework Decision 2003/568/JHA as well as corruption as defined in the national law of the contracting authority or the economic operator
corruption.eng: Corruption, as defined in Article 3 of the Convention on the fight against corruption involving officials of the European Communities or officials of Member States of the European Union  and Article 2(1) of Council Framework Decision 2003/568/JHA as well as corruption as defined in the national law of the contracting authority or the economic operator

fraud.Name: Fraud
fraud.Description: Fraud within the meaning of Article 1 of the Convention on the protection of the European Communities’ financial interests
fraud.eng: Fraud within the meaning of Article 1 of the Convention on the protection of the European Communities’ financial interests

terr-offence.Name: Terrorist offences or offences linked to terrorist activities
terr-offence.Description: Terrorist offences or offences linked to terrorist activities, as defined in Articles 1 and 3 of Council Framework Decision 2002/475/JHA respectively, or inciting or aiding or abetting or attempting to commit an offence, as referred to in Article 4 of that Framework Decision
terr-offence.eng: Terrorist offences or offences linked to terrorist activities, as defined in Articles 1 and 3 of Council Framework Decision 2002/475/JHA respectively, or inciting or aiding or abetting or attempting to commit an offence, as referred to in Article 4 of that Framework Decision

finan-laund.Name: Money laundering or terrorist financing
finan-laund.Description: Money laundering or terrorist financing, as defined in Article 1 of Directive 2005/60/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council
finan-laund.eng: Money laundering or terrorist financing, as defined in Article 1 of Directive 2005/60/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council

human-traffic.Name: Child labour and other forms of trafficking in human beings
human-traffic.Description: Child labour and other forms of trafficking in human beings as defined in Article 2 of Directive 2011/36/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council
human-traffic.eng: Child labour and other forms of trafficking in human beings as defined in Article 2 of Directive 2011/36/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council

tax-pay.Name: Payment of taxes
tax-pay.Description: Contracting authorities may exclude or may be required by Member States to exclude from participation in a procurement procedure an economic operator where the contracting authority can demonstrate by any appropriate means that the economic operator is in breach of its obligations relating to the payment of taxes or social security contributions
tax-pay.eng: Contracting authorities may exclude or may be required by Member States to exclude from participation in a procurement procedure an economic operator where the contracting authority can demonstrate by any appropriate means that the economic operator is in breach of its obligations relating to the payment of taxes or social security contributions

socsec-pay.Name: Payment of social security contributions
socsec-pay.Description: Contracting authorities may exclude or may be required by Member States to exclude from participation in a procurement procedure an economic operator where the contracting authority can demonstrate by any appropriate means that the economic operator is in breach of its obligations relating to the payment of taxes or social security contributions
socsec-pay.eng: Contracting authorities may exclude or may be required by Member States to exclude from participation in a procurement procedure an economic operator where the contracting authority can demonstrate by any appropriate means that the economic operator is in breach of its obligations relating to the payment of taxes or social security contributions

envir-law.Name: Breaching of obligations in the fields of environmental law
envir-law.Description: Where the contracting authority can demonstrate by any appropriate means a violation of applicable obligations referred to in Article 18(2) of the Directive 2014/24/EU
envir-law.eng: Where the contracting authority can demonstrate by any appropriate means a violation of applicable obligations referred to in Article 18(2) of the Directive 2014/24/EU

socsec-law.Name: Breaching of obligations in the fields of social law
socsec-law.Description: Where the contracting authority can demonstrate by any appropriate means a violation of applicable obligations referred to in Article 18(2) of the Directive 2014/24/EU
socsec-law.eng: Where the contracting authority can demonstrate by any appropriate means a violation of applicable obligations referred to in Article 18(2) of the Directive 2014/24/EU

labour-law.Name: Breaching of obligations in the fields of labour law
labour-law.Description: Where the contracting authority can demonstrate by any appropriate means a violation of applicable obligations referred to in Article 18(2) of the Directive 2014/24/EU
labour-law.eng: Where the contracting authority can demonstrate by any appropriate means a violation of applicable obligations referred to in Article 18(2) of the Directive 2014/24/EU

bankruptcy.Name: Bankruptcy
bankruptcy.Description: Where the economic operator is bankrupt or is the subject of insolvency or winding-up proceedings, where its assets are being administered by a liquidator or by the court, where it is in an arrangement with creditors, where its business activities are suspended or it is in any analogous situation arising from a similar procedure under national laws and regulations
bankruptcy.eng: Where the economic operator is bankrupt or is the subject of insolvency or winding-up proceedings, where its assets are being administered by a liquidator or by the court, where it is in an arrangement with creditors, where its business activities are suspended or it is in any analogous situation arising from a similar procedure under national laws and regulations

insolvency.Name: Insolvency
insolvency.Description: Where the economic operator is bankrupt or is the subject of insolvency or winding-up proceedings, where its assets are being administered by a liquidator or by the court, where it is in an arrangement with creditors, where its business activities are suspended or it is in any analogous situation arising from a similar procedure under national laws and regulations
insolvency.eng: Where the economic operator is bankrupt or is the subject of insolvency or winding-up proceedings, where its assets are being administered by a liquidator or by the court, where it is in an arrangement with creditors, where its business activities are suspended or it is in any analogous situation arising from a similar procedure under national laws and regulations

cred-arran.Name: Arrangement with creditors
cred-arran.Description: IWhere the economic operator is bankrupt or is the subject of insolvency or winding-up proceedings, where its assets are being administered by a liquidator or by the court, where it is in an arrangement with creditors, where its business activities are suspended or it is in any analogous situation arising from a similar procedure under national laws and regulations
cred-arran.eng: IWhere the economic operator is bankrupt or is the subject of insolvency or winding-up proceedings, where its assets are being administered by a liquidator or by the court, where it is in an arrangement with creditors, where its business activities are suspended or it is in any analogous situation arising from a similar procedure under national laws and regulations

bankr-nat.Name: Analogous situation like bankruptcy under national law
bankr-nat.Description: Where the economic operator is bankrupt or is the subject of insolvency or winding-up proceedings, where its assets are being administered by a liquidator or by the court, where it is in an arrangement with creditors, where its business activities are suspended or it is in any analogous situation arising from a similar procedure under national laws and regulations
bankr-nat.eng: Where the economic operator is bankrupt or is the subject of insolvency or winding-up proceedings, where its assets are being administered by a liquidator or by the court, where it is in an arrangement with creditors, where its business activities are suspended or it is in any analogous situation arising from a similar procedure under national laws and regulations

liq-admin.Name: Assets being administered by liquidator
liq-admin.Description: Are the assets of the economic operator being administered by a liquidator or by the court?  This information needs not be given if exclusion of economic operators in this case has been made mandatory under the applicable national law without any possibility of derogation where the economic operator is nevertheless able to perform the contract.
liq-admin.eng: Are the assets of the economic operator being administered by a liquidator or by the court?  This information needs not be given if exclusion of economic operators in this case has been made mandatory under the applicable national law without any possibility of derogation where the economic operator is nevertheless able to perform the contract.

susp-act.Name: Business activities are suspended
susp-act.Description: Where the economic operator is bankrupt or is the subject of insolvency or winding-up proceedings, where its assets are being administered by a liquidator or by the court, where it is in an arrangement with creditors, where its business activities are suspended or it is in any analogous situation arising from a similar procedure under national laws and regulations
susp-act.eng: Where the economic operator is bankrupt or is the subject of insolvency or winding-up proceedings, where its assets are being administered by a liquidator or by the court, where it is in an arrangement with creditors, where its business activities are suspended or it is in any analogous situation arising from a similar procedure under national laws and regulations

prof-misconduct.Name: Guilty of grave professional misconduct
prof-misconduct.Description: Where the contracting authority can demonstrate by appropriate means that the economic operator is guilty of grave professional misconduct, which renders its integrity questionable
prof-misconduct.eng: Where the contracting authority can demonstrate by appropriate means that the economic operator is guilty of grave professional misconduct, which renders its integrity questionable

distorsion.Name: Agreements with other economic operators aimed at distorting competition
distorsion.Description: Where the contracting authority has sufficiently plausible indications to conclude that the economic operator has entered into agreements with other economic operators aimed at distorting competition;
distorsion.eng: Where the contracting authority has sufficiently plausible indications to conclude that the economic operator has entered into agreements with other economic operators aimed at distorting competition;

partic-confl.Name: Conflict of interest due to its participation in the procurement procedure
partic-confl.Description: Any situation where staff members of the contracting authority or of a procurement service provider acting on behalf of the contracting authority who are involved in the conduct of the procurement procedure or may influence the outcome of that procedure have, directly or indirectly, a financial, economic or other personal interest which might be perceived to compromise their impartiality and independence in the context of the procurement procedure
partic-confl.eng: Any situation where staff members of the contracting authority or of a procurement service provider acting on behalf of the contracting authority who are involved in the conduct of the procurement procedure or may influence the outcome of that procedure have, directly or indirectly, a financial, economic or other personal interest which might be perceived to compromise their impartiality and independence in the context of the procurement procedure

prep-confl.Name: Direct or indirect involvement in the preparation of this procurement procedure
prep-confl.Description: Any situation where staff members of the contracting authority or of a procurement service provider acting on behalf of the contracting authority who are involved in the conduct of the procurement procedure or may influence the outcome of that procedure have, directly or indirectly, a financial, economic or other personal interest which might be perceived to compromise their impartiality and independence in the context of the procurement procedure
prep-confl.eng: Any situation where staff members of the contracting authority or of a procurement service provider acting on behalf of the contracting authority who are involved in the conduct of the procurement procedure or may influence the outcome of that procedure have, directly or indirectly, a financial, economic or other personal interest which might be perceived to compromise their impartiality and independence in the context of the procurement procedure

sanction.Name: Early termination, damages or other comparable sanctions
sanction.Description: Where the economic operator has shown significant or persistent deficiencies in the performance of a substantive requirement under a prior public contract, a prior contract with a contracting entity or a prior concession contract which led to early termination of that prior contract, damages or other comparable sanctions
sanction.eng: Where the economic operator has shown significant or persistent deficiencies in the performance of a substantive requirement under a prior public contract, a prior contract with a contracting entity or a prior concession contract which led to early termination of that prior contract, damages or other comparable sanctions

misinterpr.Name: Guilty of misinterpretation, withheld information, unable to provide required documents and obtained confidential information of this procedure
misinterpr.Description: Where the economic operator has been guilty of serious misrepresentation in supplying the information required for the verification of the absence of grounds for exclusion or the fulfilment of the selection criteria, has withheld such information or is not able to submit the supporting documents required pursuant to Article 59 of the Directive 2014/24/EU
misinterpr.eng: Where the economic operator has been guilty of serious misrepresentation in supplying the information required for the verification of the absence of grounds for exclusion or the fulfilment of the selection criteria, has withheld such information or is not able to submit the supporting documents required pursuant to Article 59 of the Directive 2014/24/EU

nati-ground.Name: Purely national exclusion grounds
nati-ground.Description: Other exclusion grounds that may be foreseen in the national legislation of the contracting authority's or contracting entity's Member State
nati-ground.eng: Other exclusion grounds that may be foreseen in the national legislation of the contracting authority's or contracting entity's Member State

prof-regist.Name: Enrolment in a relevant professional register
prof-regist.Description: With regard to suitability to pursue the professional activity, contracting authorities may require economic operators to be enrolled in one of the professional or trade registers kept in their Member State of establishment, as described in Annex XI, or to comply with any other request set out in that Annex.
prof-regist.eng: With regard to suitability to pursue the professional activity, contracting authorities may require economic operators to be enrolled in one of the professional or trade registers kept in their Member State of establishment, as described in Annex XI, or to comply with any other request set out in that Annex.

trade-regist.Name: Enrolment in a trade register
trade-regist.Description: With regard to suitability to pursue the professional activity, contracting authorities may require economic operators to be enrolled in one of the professional or trade registers kept in their Member State of establishment, as described in Annex XI, or to comply with any other request set out in that Annex.
trade-regist.eng: With regard to suitability to pursue the professional activity, contracting authorities may require economic operators to be enrolled in one of the professional or trade registers kept in their Member State of establishment, as described in Annex XI, or to comply with any other request set out in that Annex.

autorisation.Name: For service contracts: authorisation of particular organisation needed
autorisation.Description: With regard to suitability to pursue the professional activity, contracting authorities may require economic operators to be enrolled in one of the professional or trade registers kept in their Member State of establishment, as described in Annex XI, or to comply with any other request set out in that Annex.
autorisation.eng: With regard to suitability to pursue the professional activity, contracting authorities may require economic operators to be enrolled in one of the professional or trade registers kept in their Member State of establishment, as described in Annex XI, or to comply with any other request set out in that Annex.

membership.Name: For service contracts: membership of particular organisation needed
membership.Description: With regard to suitability to pursue the professional activity, contracting authorities may require economic operators to be enrolled in one of the professional or trade registers kept in their Member State of establishment, as described in Annex XI, or to comply with any other request set out in that Annex.
membership.eng: With regard to suitability to pursue the professional activity, contracting authorities may require economic operators to be enrolled in one of the professional or trade registers kept in their Member State of establishment, as described in Annex XI, or to comply with any other request set out in that Annex.

gen-year-to.Name: General yearly turnover
gen-year-to.Description: With regard to economic and financial standing, contracting authorities may impose requirements ensuring that economic operators possess the necessary economic and financial capacity to perform the contract. For that purpose, contracting authorities may require, in particular, that economic operators have a certain minimum yearly turnover, including a certain minimum turnover in the area covered by the contract. In addition, contracting authorities may require that economic operators provide information on their annual accounts showing the ratios, for instance, between assets and liabilities. They may also require an appropriate level of professional risk indemnity insurance (…)
gen-year-to.eng: With regard to economic and financial standing, contracting authorities may impose requirements ensuring that economic operators possess the necessary economic and financial capacity to perform the contract. For that purpose, contracting authorities may require, in particular, that economic operators have a certain minimum yearly turnover, including a certain minimum turnover in the area covered by the contract. In addition, contracting authorities may require that economic operators provide information on their annual accounts showing the ratios, for instance, between assets and liabilities. They may also require an appropriate level of professional risk indemnity insurance (…)

aver-year-to.Name: Average yearly turnover
aver-year-to.Description: With regard to economic and financial standing, contracting authorities may impose requirements ensuring that economic operators possess the necessary economic and financial capacity to perform the contract. For that purpose, contracting authorities may require, in particular, that economic operators have a certain minimum yearly turnover, including a certain minimum turnover in the area covered by the contract. In addition, contracting authorities may require that economic operators provide information on their annual accounts showing the ratios, for instance, between assets and liabilities. They may also require an appropriate level of professional risk indemnity insurance (…)
aver-year-to.eng: With regard to economic and financial standing, contracting authorities may impose requirements ensuring that economic operators possess the necessary economic and financial capacity to perform the contract. For that purpose, contracting authorities may require, in particular, that economic operators have a certain minimum yearly turnover, including a certain minimum turnover in the area covered by the contract. In addition, contracting authorities may require that economic operators provide information on their annual accounts showing the ratios, for instance, between assets and liabilities. They may also require an appropriate level of professional risk indemnity insurance (…)

spec-aver-to.Name: Specific average turnover
spec-aver-to.Description: With regard to economic and financial standing, contracting authorities may impose requirements ensuring that economic operators possess the necessary economic and financial capacity to perform the contract. For that purpose, contracting authorities may require, in particular, that economic operators have a certain minimum yearly turnover, including a certain minimum turnover in the area covered by the contract. In addition, contracting authorities may require that economic operators provide information on their annual accounts showing the ratios, for instance, between assets and liabilities. They may also require an appropriate level of professional risk indemnity insurance (…)
spec-aver-to.eng: With regard to economic and financial standing, contracting authorities may impose requirements ensuring that economic operators possess the necessary economic and financial capacity to perform the contract. For that purpose, contracting authorities may require, in particular, that economic operators have a certain minimum yearly turnover, including a certain minimum turnover in the area covered by the contract. In addition, contracting authorities may require that economic operators provide information on their annual accounts showing the ratios, for instance, between assets and liabilities. They may also require an appropriate level of professional risk indemnity insurance (…)

spec-year-to.Name: Specific yearly turnover
spec-year-to.Description: With regard to economic and financial standing, contracting authorities may impose requirements ensuring that economic operators possess the necessary economic and financial capacity to perform the contract. For that purpose, contracting authorities may require, in particular, that economic operators have a certain minimum yearly turnover, including a certain minimum turnover in the area covered by the contract. In addition, contracting authorities may require that economic operators provide information on their annual accounts showing the ratios, for instance, between assets and liabilities. They may also require an appropriate level of professional risk indemnity insurance (…)
spec-year-to.eng: With regard to economic and financial standing, contracting authorities may impose requirements ensuring that economic operators possess the necessary economic and financial capacity to perform the contract. For that purpose, contracting authorities may require, in particular, that economic operators have a certain minimum yearly turnover, including a certain minimum turnover in the area covered by the contract. In addition, contracting authorities may require that economic operators provide information on their annual accounts showing the ratios, for instance, between assets and liabilities. They may also require an appropriate level of professional risk indemnity insurance (…)

finan-rat.Name: Financial ratio
finan-rat.Description: Concerning the financial ratios  specified in the relevant notice, the in the ESPD, the relevant notice or  or the ESPD, the economic operator declares that the actual values for the required ratios are as follows:
finan-rat.eng: Concerning the financial ratios  specified in the relevant notice, the in the ESPD, the relevant notice or  or the ESPD, the economic operator declares that the actual values for the required ratios are as follows:

indem-insu.Name: Professional risk indemnity insurance
indem-insu.Description: The insured amount in its professional risk indemnity insurance is the following:
indem-insu.eng: The insured amount in its professional risk indemnity insurance is the following:

finan-requ.Name: Other economic or financial requirements
finan-requ.Description: Concerning the other economic or financial requirements, if any, that may have been specified in the relevant notice or in the ESPD, the economic operator declares that:
finan-requ.eng: Concerning the other economic or financial requirements, if any, that may have been specified in the relevant notice or in the ESPD, the economic operator declares that:

work-perform.Name: For works contracts: performance of works of the specified type
work-perform.Description: A list of the works carried out over at the most the past five years, accompanied by certificates of satisfactory execution and outcome for the most important works; where necessary in order to ensure an adequate level of competition, contracting authorities may indicate that evidence of relevant works carried out more than five years before will be taken into account
work-perform.eng: A list of the works carried out over at the most the past five years, accompanied by certificates of satisfactory execution and outcome for the most important works; where necessary in order to ensure an adequate level of competition, contracting authorities may indicate that evidence of relevant works carried out more than five years before will be taken into account

supply-perform.Name: For supply contracts: performance of deliveries of the specified type
supply-perform.Description: A list of the principal deliveries effected or the main services provided over at the most the past three years, with the sums, dates and recipients, whether public or private, involved. Where necessary in order to ensure an adequate level of competition, contracting authorities may indicate that evidence of relevant supplies or services delivered or performed more than three years before will be taken into account
supply-perform.eng: A list of the principal deliveries effected or the main services provided over at the most the past three years, with the sums, dates and recipients, whether public or private, involved. Where necessary in order to ensure an adequate level of competition, contracting authorities may indicate that evidence of relevant supplies or services delivered or performed more than three years before will be taken into account

service-perform.Name: For service contracts: performance of services of the specified type
service-perform.Description: A list of the principal deliveries effected or the main services provided over at the most the past three years, with the sums, dates and recipients, whether public or private, involved. Where necessary in order to ensure an adequate level of competition, contracting authorities may indicate that evidence of relevant supplies or services delivered or performed more than three years before will be taken into account
service-perform.eng: A list of the principal deliveries effected or the main services provided over at the most the past three years, with the sums, dates and recipients, whether public or private, involved. Where necessary in order to ensure an adequate level of competition, contracting authorities may indicate that evidence of relevant supplies or services delivered or performed more than three years before will be taken into account

qual-cont-tech.Name: Technicians or technical bodies for quality control
qual-cont-tech.Description: An indication of the technicians or technical bodies involved, whether or not belonging directly to the economic operator’s undertaking, especially those responsible for quality control and, in the case of public works contracts, those upon whom the contractor can call in order to carry out the work
qual-cont-tech.eng: An indication of the technicians or technical bodies involved, whether or not belonging directly to the economic operator’s undertaking, especially those responsible for quality control and, in the case of public works contracts, those upon whom the contractor can call in order to carry out the work

work-tech.Name: For works contracts: technicians or technical bodies to carry out the work
work-tech.Description: An indication of the technicians or technical bodies involved, whether or not belonging directly to the economic operator’s undertaking, especially those responsible for quality control and, in the case of public works contracts, those upon whom the contractor can call in order to carry out the work
work-tech.eng: An indication of the technicians or technical bodies involved, whether or not belonging directly to the economic operator’s undertaking, especially those responsible for quality control and, in the case of public works contracts, those upon whom the contractor can call in order to carry out the work

qual-facil.Name: Technical facilities and measures for ensuring quality
qual-facil.Description: A description of the technical facilities and measures used by the economic operator for ensuring quality and the undertaking’s study and research facilities
qual-facil.eng: A description of the technical facilities and measures used by the economic operator for ensuring quality and the undertaking’s study and research facilities

research-fac.Name: Study and research facilities
research-fac.Description: A description of the technical facilities and measures used by the economic operator for ensuring quality and the undertaking’s study and research facilities
research-fac.eng: A description of the technical facilities and measures used by the economic operator for ensuring quality and the undertaking’s study and research facilities

chain-manage.Name: Supply chain management
chain-manage.Description: An indication of the supply chain management and tracking systems that the economic operator will be able to apply when performing the contract
chain-manage.eng: An indication of the supply chain management and tracking systems that the economic operator will be able to apply when performing the contract

qualification.Name: Educational and professional qualifications
qualification.Description: The educational and professional qualifications of the service provider or contractor or those of the undertaking’s managerial staff, provided that they are not evaluated as an award criterion
qualification.eng: The educational and professional qualifications of the service provider or contractor or those of the undertaking’s managerial staff, provided that they are not evaluated as an award criterion

envir-measure.Name: Environmental management measures
envir-measure.Description: An indication of the environmental management measures that the economic operator will be able to apply when performing the contract
envir-measure.eng: An indication of the environmental management measures that the economic operator will be able to apply when performing the contract

tech-equip.Name: Tools, plant or technical equipment
tech-equip.Description: A statement of the tools, plant or technical equipment available to the service provider or contractor for carrying out the contract
tech-equip.eng: A statement of the tools, plant or technical equipment available to the service provider or contractor for carrying out the contract

spec-req-check.Name: Special requierements check
spec-req-check.Description: Where the products or services to be supplied are complex or, exceptionally, are required for a special purpose, a check carried out by the contracting authorities or on their behalf by a competent official body of the country in which the supplier or service provider is established, subject to that body’s agreement, on the production capacities of the supplier or the technical capacity of the service provider and, where necessary, on the means of study and research which are available to it and the quality control measures it will operate
spec-req-check.eng: Where the products or services to be supplied are complex or, exceptionally, are required for a special purpose, a check carried out by the contracting authorities or on their behalf by a competent official body of the country in which the supplier or service provider is established, subject to that body’s agreement, on the production capacities of the supplier or the technical capacity of the service provider and, where necessary, on the means of study and research which are available to it and the quality control measures it will operate

manage-staff\n.Name: Number of managerial staff
manage-staff\n.Description: The economic operator’s number of managerial staff for the last three years were as follows:
manage-staff\n.eng: The economic operator’s number of managerial staff for the last three years were as follows:

year-manpower.Name: Average annual manpower
year-manpower.Description: The educational and professional qualifications of the service provider or contractor or those of the undertaking’s managerial staff, provided that they are not evaluated as an award criterion
year-manpower.eng: The educational and professional qualifications of the service provider or contractor or those of the undertaking’s managerial staff, provided that they are not evaluated as an award criterion

suncont-port.Name: Subcontracting proportion
suncont-port.Description: An indication of the proportion of the contract which the economic operator intends possibly to subcontract
suncont-port.eng: An indication of the proportion of the contract which the economic operator intends possibly to subcontract

wo-autent\n.Name: For supply contracts: samples, descriptions or photographs with certification of authenticity
wo-autent\n.Description: Samples, descriptions or photographs, the authenticity of which must be certified where the contracting authority so requests
wo-autent\n.eng: For public supply contracts: The economic operator will supply the required samples, descriptions or photographs of the products to be supplied, which do not need to be accompanied by certifications of authenticity.

w-autent.Name: For supply contracts: samples, descriptions or photographs with certification of authenticity
w-autent.Description: Samples, descriptions or photographs, the authenticity of which must be certified where the contracting authority so requests
w-autent.eng: Samples, descriptions or photographs, the authenticity of which must be certified where the contracting authority so requests

qa-certif-inst.Name: For supply contracts: certificates by quality control institutes
qa-certif-inst.Description: Certificates drawn up by official quality control institutes or agencies of recognised competence attesting the conformity of products clearly identified by references to technical specifications or standards
qa-certif-inst.eng: Certificates drawn up by official quality control institutes or agencies of recognised competence attesting the conformity of products clearly identified by references to technical specifications or standards

qu-certif-indep\n.Name: Certificates by independent bodies about quality assurance standards
qu-certif-indep\n.Description: Certificates drawn up by official quality control institutes or agencies of recognised competence attesting the conformity of products clearly identified by references to technical specifications or standards
qu-certif-indep\n.eng: Certificates drawn up by official quality control institutes or agencies of recognised competence attesting the conformity of products clearly identified by references to technical specifications or standards

envir-certif-indep.Name: Certificates by independent bodies about environmental management systems or standards
envir-certif-indep.Description: Certificates drawn up by official quality control institutes or agencies of recognised competence attesting the conformity of products clearly identified by references to technical specifications or standards
envir-certif-indep.eng: Certificates drawn up by official quality control institutes or agencies of recognised competence attesting the conformity of products clearly identified by references to technical specifications or standards

shelt-worksh.Name: Economic operator is a sheltered workshop
shelt-worksh.Description: In reserved contracts, Member States may reserve the right to participate in public procurement procedures to sheltered workshops and economic operators whose main aim is the social and professional integration of disabled or disadvantaged persons or may provide for such contracts to be performed in the context of sheltered employment programmes, provided that at least 30 % of the employees of those workshops, economic operators or programmes are disabled or disadvantaged workers
shelt-worksh.eng: In reserved contracts, Member States may reserve the right to participate in public procurement procedures to sheltered workshops and economic operators whose main aim is the social and professional integration of disabled or disadvantaged persons or may provide for such contracts to be performed in the context of sheltered employment programmes, provided that at least 30 % of the employees of those workshops, economic operators or programmes are disabled or disadvantaged workers

registered.Name: Economic operator registered in a pre qualification system
registered.Description: Economic operators registered on the official lists or having a certificate may, for each contract, submit to the contracting authority a certificate of registration issued by the competent authority or the certificate issued by the competent certification body.
registered.eng: Economic operators registered on the official lists or having a certificate may, for each contract, submit to the contracting authority a certificate of registration issued by the competent authority or the certificate issued by the competent certification body.

eo-group.Name: Economic Operator together with others
eo-group.Description:
2. Groups of economic operators, including temporary associations, may participate in procurement procedures. They shall not be required by contracting authorities to have a specific legal form in order to submit a tender or a request to participate.

Where necessary, contracting authorities may clarify in the procurement documents how groups of economic operators are to meet the requirements as to economic and financial standing or technical and professional ability referred to in Article 58 provided that this is justified by objective reasons and is proportionate. Member States may establish standard terms for how groups of economic operators are to meet those requirements.

Any conditions for the performance of a contract by such groups of economic operators, which are different from those imposed on individual participants, shall also be justified by objective reasons and shall be proportionate.

3.   Notwithstanding paragraph 2, contracting authorities may require groups of economic operators to assume a specific legal form once they have been awarded the contract, to the extent that such a change is necessary for the satisfactory performance of the contract.
eo-group.eng:
2. Groups of economic operators, including temporary associations, may participate in procurement procedures. They shall not be required by contracting authorities to have a specific legal form in order to submit a tender or a request to participate.

Where necessary, contracting authorities may clarify in the procurement documents how groups of economic operators are to meet the requirements as to economic and financial standing or technical and professional ability referred to in Article 58 provided that this is justified by objective reasons and is proportionate. Member States may establish standard terms for how groups of economic operators are to meet those requirements.

Any conditions for the performance of a contract by such groups of economic operators, which are different from those imposed on individual participants, shall also be justified by objective reasons and shall be proportionate.

3.   Notwithstanding paragraph 2, contracting authorities may require groups of economic operators to assume a specific legal form once they have been awarded the contract, to the extent that such a change is necessary for the satisfactory performance of the contract.

relied.Name: Economic operator rely on the capacities of other entities in order to meet the selection criteria set out under Part IV and the criteria and rules (if any) set out under Part V
relied.Description: An indication of the proportion of the contract which the economic operator intends possibly to subcontract
relied.eng: An indication of the proportion of the contract which the economic operator intends possibly to subcontract

subco-ent.Name: Subcontracted entities
subco-ent.Description: The contracting authority may ask or may be required by a Member State to ask the tenderer to indicate in its tender any share of the contract it may intend to subcontract to third parties and any proposed subcontractors.
subco-ent.eng: The contracting authority may ask or may be required by a Member State to ask the tenderer to indicate in its tender any share of the contract it may intend to subcontract to third parties and any proposed subcontractors.

staff-red.Name: Reduction of the number of qualified candidates
staff-red.Description: In restricted procedures, competitive procedures with negotiation, competitive dialogue procedures and innovation partnerships, contracting authorities may limit the number of candidates meeting the selection criteria that they will invite to tender or to conduct a dialogue
staff-red.eng: In restricted procedures, competitive procedures with negotiation, competitive dialogue procedures and innovation partnerships, contracting authorities may limit the number of candidates meeting the selection criteria that they will invite to tender or to conduct a dialogue

sme.Name: EO SME
sme.Description: In accordance with the EU recommendation 2003/361 EO should specify if they are SME companies. The fact of take into account SMEs is tackled in the Directive 2014/24/EU aiming to democratize the applications on European Procurement.
sme.eng: In accordance with the EU recommendation 2003/361 EO should specify if they are SME companies. The fact of take into account SMEs is tackled in the Directive 2014/24/EU aiming to democratize the applications on European Procurement.

name: criterion
